item.title: Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As an Analytics Developer, you will develop our analytics infrastructure to make it more flexible, reliable, and performant. This role requires cooperation, coordination with quant, trading, and IT groups. You possess strong programming and API design skills.

Previous projects with low latency or high throughput analytics, and interest in financial products across asset classes would be preferred, but isn’t necessary.

What will you do? 

  • Refactor and consolidate analytics-related functionality.
  • Design robust API’s around common pieces of functionality, refactoring the code to support these new APIs, retire legacy code, and ensure that structural problems are also addressed during the refactoring.
  • Investigate and fix stability problems, determine what the fundamental solution should be, and prioritize accordingly.
  • Identify and address gaps in test coverage.
  • Interface with vendor systems, expose analytics to Excel and Risk systems.
  • Proposes the design and implementation of strategic analytics API’s.
  • Analyze and fix performance and stability problems in the internal analytics layers.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have:

  • Strong command of C++, Python or Java.
  • Expert in algorithms and data structures, object orientation, design patterns, and functional programming paradigms.
  • Excellent problem solving and quantitative skills.
  • Excellent API design, refactoring, profiling and code optimization skills.
  • Experience as a senior developer or team lead.

Nice to have:

  • Expertise with designing and supporting financial analytics API’s.
  • Experience with databases, distributed cache products, distributed and multithreaded computation, big data processing technologies such as Spark.
  • Experience with multiple platforms (Windows, Linux), compilers and tools for C++ development.
  • Experience with .Net.
  • Experience with build/test/release infrastructure.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-05-02-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-10-28-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Trading Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trading Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Capital Markets Technology, Equities group is seeking a Senior Software Developer to work on a Risk & Execution Services Applications supporting the Equity Derivatives trading desks. The platform stores risk analytics generated by a proprietary valuation engine and makes them available through a variety of interfaces to Traders. The applications also involve saving market data, running reports and analysis to serve the trading desk.

What will you do?

  • Work as a member of a global team to build Technology solutions used across the Equity and Equity Derivatives trading desks (Flow, DLO, STP, CED, CASH).
  • Create UI and interact with user to create the best user experience
  • Work with Capital Market UI Framework (React JS, Javascript, python)
  • Create Data providers to source data from various services (C#, python) to feed the UI
  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable Python, C# data loading, extracts and transformations.
  • Transition existing UIs into the new one
    • Back-End: C#/python – Docker/K8s deployment
    • Front-End: Web Application
  • Create Services and Rest endpoints for application
  • Work with Traders on daily applications and Implement solutions for their asks
  • Check-In code under source control (github/svn)
  • Create Build and Deployment Script (shell) on Jenkins
  • Scripts to source control Git/Docker/K8s

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ Years of Experience in Web Front-End Development (Javascript, React JS)
  • 3+ Years of Experience in Python
  • 3+ Years of OOO Development (Java, C#)
  • Experience with of UI/UX Styling
  • Knowledge of Database (SQL, Indexing, clustering, performance)
  • Knowledge of distributed architectures
  • Knowledge and understanding of Equity Derivatives
  • Experience with DevOps (Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm
  • Experience with REST, RPC, IDL
  • Understanding of Equity Derivatives and Risk frameworks
  • Basic understanding of Equity Derivatives Pricing, Greeks and Risk
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis (time series, linear regression)
  • Ability to adapt and learn new languages and Technology
  • Team work, ability collaboration with other groups/teams

Nice-to-have

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Experience with C#

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, on progressive thinking to keep growing, and on working together to deliver trusted advice to our clients and help communities prosper.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with business stakeholders.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Job Summary

New York, New York, United States of America

City:

USA-NY-NEW YORK

Country:

United States of America

40

Full time

item.title: Sr. Manager Product Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Product Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?​

  • Support the analytics needs of the PL (Personal Lending) business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Deliver concise, timely and insightful reporting to senior management on relevant matters relating to the business including acquisition, retention, growth, engagement, and market share. This includes benefits tracking for transformational programs such as Retail Credit Reinvention (RCR)
  • Forecast modeling of application volumes, booking rates and other key metrics by product and channel to support Personal Lending senior management and other stakeholder groups including OMNI, Credit Adjudication, Operations and Finance
  • Work closely with partner groups to provide analytics and required reports for critical initiatives (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience in analytics and financial modelling
  • SQL experience along with other advanced programming capabilities in SAS, Python, or R
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and strategic analysis
  • Effective presentation of analysis, actionable insights, and recommendations to senior management
  • Excellent collaboration skills to build and cultivate strong working partnerships with business partners and other stakeholders
  • Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or a related business or quantitative field.

Nice-To-Have

  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling, credit scoring for acquisition and account management
  • Understanding and experience building segmentation and predictive models
  • Developer experience using data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau)
  • Data strategy experience, data automation

Job Summary

As the Senior Manager, Product Analytics, you will be responsible for supporting the analytics and data needs of the Personal Lending Product team. This includes providing actionable insights, data-driven product strategy, and recommendations to senior leadership to drive growth and profitability.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

item.title: Manager, Stress Testing Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Stress Testing Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Associate Director, Stress Testing Analytics will implement stress testing components and participate in risk management analytics and processes to minimize credit risk. The ideal candidate will apply extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

What will you do?

  • Develops and maintains tools used for the implementation and execution of credit risk models. These models are used in the measurement of Expected Credit Loss (ECL), Provision for Credit Losses, and RWA for internal and regulatory stress testing.
  • Execute the production of stress testing projections for internal and regulatory filings.
  • Identify ECL production challenges and conducts independent problem solving to resolve proficiently.
  • Communicate results and analyses to management and key stakeholders.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Experience with SAS & Python programming
  • Experience with data analytics
  • Knowledge of credit products in the financial industry

Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with statistical modelling of credit products
  • Experience with stress testing programs in the financial industry

​

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

Monitors market risk and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.title: Manager, Credit Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Credit Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This is a highly technical role requiring hands-on experience with data and decisioning tools to provide support to the credit strategy partners to execute direct marketing campaigns and initiatives. This role will continuously challenge and seek to improve the efficiency and accuracy of risk eligible rules and strategy implementation design and processes utilizing new technologies and data sources.

What will you do?

  • Design, build, and test strategy changes in various platforms to ensure flawless implementation
  • Complete quality assurance audits to ensure the design & build has been accurately interpreted to meets the business need
  • Strong in data analysis and data sciences
  • Develops clearly written documentation for strategy changes that are tailored to different audiences including business groups, QA, IT and senior management
  • Seeks opportunities to utilize RBC data sources to develop automation of execution and testing activities. Identifies and implements new methods or processes to shorten the execution cycle or to reduce costs
  • Ensure that strategy implementation standard methodology and best practices are implemented in day to day routines

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 3+ years expertise in relational database marketing and structured programming concepts, including the use of data analytics and decisioning tools (e.g., SAS, SQL, Python, SPARK)
  • 3+ years’ experience in application of experimental design
  • Strong data analytical skillsets and mind-set
  • Strong project management, time management and implementation skills
  • Strong problem resolution and decision-making skills
  • Strong written/oral communication skills to develop and convey thoughtful and insightful explanations

item.title: Developer - RAMPP Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - RAMPP Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Credit Trading desks at RBC are undergoing significant investment to modernize the calculation and speed of their existing trading platform.  Throughout 2022 and onwards we aim to move the business to a modern distributed pricing based framework, utilizing python, Kubernetes and docker for distribution.  You will work to build out a greenfield credit trading platform, building microservices for pricing, and working directly and closely with front office trading and quant teams.  The role will involve a lot of direct communication with front office users and will be based in RBC’s new London office at 100 Bishopsgate.

What will you do?

  • Work with our Front office and quant trading teams to understand their existing risk and pricing systems
  • Implement pricing and booking services in python
  • Develop high quality service-oriented REST endpoints
  • Work closely with a Front-End team to deliver a consolidated platform
  • Ensure the platform can perform effectively by utilising Kubernetes-based scaling technologies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Excellent python experience
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Knowledge of building enterprise-class applications at scale
  • Basic financial knowledge in any asset class
  • Good knowledge of enterprise-level concepts such as integration and regression testing

Nice-to-have

  • Experience building containerised applications
  • Derivatives knowledge

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Developer, XVA technology

London, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

item.title: Director, Data Analytics & Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Data Analytics & Insights

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The PSI (Personal Savings & Investments) Strategy & Analytics team collaborates with all Mutual Fund Distribution, GIC & Savings and Direct Investing product owners to support the creation and evolution of cross PSI LOB strategies.

In this role, you are responsible to provide leadership in the development and implementation of PSI’s Data and Analytics Strategy and associated capabilities to transform the experience for PSI clients through the Investments MegaJourney.  The aim of the initiatives under this strategy is to provide leadership and stand-up a data squad that enhances the client experience from front-to-back and end-to-end; leverage data to drive initiatives to improve client engagement; and produce impactful analytics to senior leadership and drive business strategy.  You have the opportunity to work cross-functionally within RBC (data, digital, marketing, operations, regulatory) to ensure alignment in data and analytics to support the MegaJourney.  Partner with internal and external partners to identify partnership opportunities that are beneficial to PSI/RBC and maximize shareholder value by optimizing the client experience, driving profitability and efficiency through business insights supported by best-in-class data and analytics.

What will you do?

Drive PSI critical business imperatives to unlock growth and develop client’s relationship with RBC

  • Provide thought leadership and serve as a centre of expertise on the use of data as a strategic asset for RBC, particularly within the PSI businesses
  • Offer business and strategic leadership to an agile data team of project personnel and stakeholders in the development and implementation of a series of initiatives to transform the front-to-back and end-to-end processes for PSI clients
  • Inform strategy for a robust data infrastructure providing accurate and consistent analytics and reporting within PSI, and drive initiatives to augment the EDW / data lake environments with new data and analytics capabilities with objective of delivering a more holistic retail investing and banking client experience
  • Transform the way PSI uses data by proactively identifying opportunities,  implementing advanced reporting and analytics tools and processes to enable us to be a data and insights-driven business
  • Responsible for innovation and taking ideas, relating to the PSI business, from concept to implementation
  • Expected to influence executives and other key decision makers by leveraging their experience, logical approach to problem solving as well as his/her excellent ability to present and communicate
  • Leads the market with competitive insights to support the deep client understanding required to underpin competitively differentiated experiences
  • Consistently deliver data driven insights and analytics to drive business and strategic decisions
  • Establish data strategy and infrastructure with key partners to support Investments MegaJourney and drive future analytics

What do you need to succeed? 

Behavioral Competencies:

  • Improves Performance: Sets and pursues a standard for performance which is higher than that set by management. Measures outcomes against that standard. Makes specific changes in the system or in own work methods to improve performance (e.g., efficiency/effectiveness, improves quality, customer/service partner satisfaction, profitable revenue growth.
  • Strong customer service attitude: Seeks innovative means of satisfying client needs in a digital channel while maintaining profitability in a well-controlled environment.
  • Adapts to the situation: Acts decisively based on the circumstances of the situation. Enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar assignments.
  • Builds trust and Fosters Win-Win Mentality: Tailors approach, presentations or discussions to appeal to the interest and level of others.
  • Identifies Opportunities for Business Improvement: Questions and challenges existing processes, procedures, methodologies and/or technologies. Investigates or creates new ways to look at current practices to develop new solutions to existing problems or practices. Recognizes a current technology or business opportunity and finds ways to leverage the current capabilities of RBC Financial Group to take advantage of these opportunities.
  • Provides Rationale: Understands basic business issues. Goes beyond answering the question. Helps others resolve basic problems related to own area of expertise. Provides information people need to know to do their job and make accurate decisions.
  • Execution Excellence: Drives performance and sustains/drives results from self and others through professional excellence and effective execution. Manages high-performance teams and holds them accountable for delivering results. Prepares for implementation by identifying the interdependencies throughout the process and by taking the necessary action to escalate potential issues.
  • Develops Self and Others: Focuses on self-development, coaching, mentoring and development of others.  Fosters an environment where great work is encouraged and celebrated.
  • Data mining skills using SAS, SQL, R, or Python; solid technical skill set including the creation and delivery of customer analytics, research and profitability results into business outcomes

Key Technical Competencies

  • Strong analytical skills demonstrated by leveraging data to drive insights and value to an organization
  • Strategic mindset and vision of the future for the PSI businesses
  • Well-developed leadership and relationship competencies (ability to lead internal, cross-enterprise, and external teams)
  • Strong business acumen and ability to conceptualize changes in market conditions and leverage innovative thinking to develop and capitalize on strategic opportunities
  • Strong impact & influence
  • Expert knowledge of working with data in relational databases and/or Hadoop
  • Proven technical skills and experience at using analytical software tools and applications such as SAS, Tableau, SQL, Python

What’s in it for you?

 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2022-10-03-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-10-17-07:00

We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Manager, Cards Analytics and Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Cards Analytics and Insights

Job Description

RBC is currently recruiting for a Manager role for the Cards, Payments and Banking team. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Providing end-to-end analytics advisory services including conceptualizing business questions, designing and executing analytics framework and recommending and influencing the credit card business for decision making purpose
  • Identifying underlying business trends using analytical tools and transforming them into actionable insights

What will you do?

  • Act as a subject matter expert regarding analytics / data science topics (e.g. data visualization, storytelling, KPI definition, statistical analysis, predictive modelling etc.).
  • Support business growth targets by understanding business needs and providing concise, insightful and timely analytics of key trends through interpretation of interplays between portfolio / business performance, costs and business strategy.
  • Assist Senior Manager and collaborate with business partners in rapid identification, prioritization and deployment of analytics to define new potential business opportunities and to support decisions through the provision of industry and competitor data.
  • Participate in cross-functional teams through the analytics process to make sound information-based decisions and develop robust measures to effectively identify, mitigate and monitor risks and opportunities.
  • Present and defend analysis and recommendations to a wide range of stakeholders and senior key decision makers.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have     

  • At least two previous work term experiences in clients, product, marketing or risk analytical or reporting role; Experiences in supporting credit card business and/or financial services industry an asset
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Instinctive curiosity and strategic mindset to drill into the analytics to understand business drivers and predict business growth and the technical ability to apply this knowledge to resolve complex business questions
  • Proven ability to communicate clearly and concisely to all levels of the company. Strong skills in presentation and story telling
  • A hunger for continued development and learning

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge in Hadoop, Google Analytics and Big Data environment
  • Advance degree in quantitative discipline

Job Summary

item.title: Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Design and develop innovative reporting solutions to monitor operational performance, present insights to underlying drivers, and support leaders in managing their business
  • Source data from various platforms and build automated data pipelines
  • Lead conversations with business partners to solicit requirements and project feedback
  • Apply standard design principles and advanced data visualization techniques to provide actionable insights
  • Test and validate new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Advanced proficiency in developing reports using Tableau
  • Proven innovative mindset with quantitative analytical and problem solving skills
  • Nimble with SQL for querying and joining large datasets and/or creating reports (e.g. MSSQL, Teradata, HDFS)
  • Demonstrated capabilities with Python or other automation technologies (e.g. Datameer)
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leadership in order to inform strategic decisions
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working independently
  • A team player who is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback when needed

Nice-to-have

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
  • Experience with technologies such as GitHub, Jira, general APIs
  • Project management capabilities

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?
RBC Canadian Banking Operations (CBO) Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence is hiring a Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics role that will lead strategic insights for CBO by utilizing cutting edge technologies to drive digital operations. The position plays a key role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Regular

Salaried

item.title: Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The PSI (Personal Savings & Investments) Strategy & Analytics team collaborates with all Mutual Fund Distribution, GIC & Savings and Direct Investing product owners to support the creation and evolution of cross PSI LOB strategies.

In this role, you are responsible for generating, translating, and supporting world class product insights that enhance RBC’s client experience, drive business results, and increase loyalty to all PSI products.  You will serve as the primary business liaison to PSI LOBs for data, analytics and insights.  By establishing strong collaborative relationships with leaders across the LOBs, you will support and deliver business insights that drive results for the PSI platform.

What will you do?

 Drive all LOB’s critical business imperatives to unlock growth and develop client’s product loyalty to RBC

  • Work with the Sr. Director and LOB leads to leverage product and client insights that impact and influence the delivery of business strategies and tactics and to balance near, mid, and long-term business growth
  • Work closely with internal clients to support their product analytics requirements in order to ensure the delivery of timely, and relevant Insights that are aligned against critical business imperatives
  • Support the alignment of analytics across PSI to improve efficiency in strategic insights and maximize LOBs growth potential
  • Support the definition and adoption of key platform-focused client centric business strategies and tactics including: Client Acquisition & Onboarding; Activation & Cross Sell; Reactivation & Retention strategies
  • Data and Reporting Capability Development (Tools, processes, procedures)
  • Drive continuous improvement to PSI reporting tools, processes, policies, and procedures
  • Provide thought leadership across the organization in representing the added value of enhanced PSI client knowledge and product insights in delivering sustainable differentiation and business results

 What do you need to succeed? 

 Must-have:

  • A strategic business analytics professional with 4+ years of progressively responsible experience in customer or product insights and analytics.
  • Ability to lead implementation of product strategies by providing analytical and reporting support focused on data analysis & financial impact
  • Data mining skills using SAS, SQL, R, or Python; solid technical skill set including the creation and delivery of customer analytics, research and profitability results into business outcomes
  • Strong critical thinking; demonstrated ability to leverage product insights to draw meaningful conclusions and recommendations; balances the art and science.
  • An experienced project manager and facilitator who can effectively bring together internal stakeholders in a way that will result in innovative new ideas.

Nice-to-have

  • Familiar with online tools such as Google Analytics Premium and Tableau
  • Advanced knowledge of R, Python, SQL or SAS
  • Ability to code in Scala, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML and related languages an asset
  • Previous work experience using cloud computing environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) an asset

What’s in it for you?

 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

Country:

Canada

Full time
